blocks.text: Now sin^{-1} x is an inverse trigonometric function, and it is such a function that if y = sin⁡x, then sin⁡y = x.
To differentiate sin^{-1} x with regard to x.
Let y = sin^{-1} x so that, from definition, sin y = x.

blocks.description: The derivative of sin^{-1} x with respect to x.

blocks.text: Similarly (x being supposed to vary between 0 and π/2).
Now \tan^{-1} x = y, and sec^2 y = 1 + \tan^2 y.

blocks.description: The derivative of tan^{-1} x with respect to x.
Final expression for the derivative of tan^{-1} x.
